thread.title: Tracy Morgan Alludes to Accident in New "Saturday Night Live" Promo
thread.title_full: Tracy Morgan Alludes to Accident in New "Saturday Night Live" Promo

title: Tracy Morgan Alludes to Accident in New "Saturday Night Live" Promo
text:
Tracy Morgan Alludes to Accident in New "Saturday Night Live" Promo Posted just a moment ago 
ABC/Randy Holmes (NEW YORK) -- In new promos for his upcoming hosting gig on Saturday Night Live , Tracy Morgan appears to make a joke that alludes to the 2014 car accident that seriously injured him. 
In one clip, cast member Bobby Moynihan tells Morgan it's an honor to have him back. Morgan, a former SNL star himself, pretends he doesn't remember working for the show. 
Morgan later smiles and says, "Yeah, I remember. I remember everything. Yeah, I remember you owe me $72." 
"Are you sure?" Moynihan asks. 
"It might have been $78," Morgan replies. 
"I think that was [former cast member] Horatio Sanz," Moynihan points out. 
"Right," Morgan agrees. 
In another promo, Morgan cracks, "I'm going to get everyone in this building pregnant!" 
Morgan hosts NBC's Saturday Night Live this weekend, with musical guest Demi Lovato. 
SNL marks another milestone in Morgan's comeback from the accident. Last month, he presented at the Emmy Awards, and earlier this week he performed stand-up at a New York City club. In addition, he will make an appearance at the Kennedy Center gala this Sunday honoring Eddie Murphy as the 2015 recipient of the Mark Twain Prize for American Humor.
